sentences.en: I did not mean to impugn her professional abilities.
sentences.cn: 我并不是怀疑她的专业能力。

sentences.en: Overly proud people refuse to admit their mistakes — and sometimes even deny the fact that they make them — because they feel that it would impugn their image.
sentences.cn: 过于自负的人拒绝承认自己的错误 — 甚至有时候否认自己制造错误的事实 — 因为他们感觉那将会打击到自己的形象。

sentences.en: Rose and I differ somewhat in our definition of art. Not to impugn your work, sir.
sentences.cn: 我们在艺术上的见解颇有分歧,我不是在批评你的作品.

trans.tran_en: to express doubts about someone’s honesty, courage, ability etc
